business.headline: Hindustan Zinc shares may climb to Rs 660. Here's why Jefferies is bullishAccording to brokerage firm Jefferies, the Rs 660 target price suggests a potential upside of around 22%, including a dividend yield of about 4%.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; NTPC down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.84 points to 84,872.82, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 129.75 points to 25,917.20 as of 9:29 am.

Want to save tax? Here's how gifting mutual funds can help you with itA lesser-known method is gaining attention, gifting mutual fund units to relatives to legally reduce, or in some cases completely avoid, tax on capital gains.

Park Medi World IPO: Check allotment status as GMP falls to its lowestPark Medi World IPO closed with an overall subscription of 8.52 times, showing steady demand across categories even as premium expectations cooled.

Goa fire tragedy: From compensation to insurance, what victims can claimThe Uphaar cinema fire in Delhi, the Kumbakonam school blaze, the Mumbai Kamala Mills fire, the Surat coaching centre tragedy, each incident left behind not just casualties, but families pushed into years of legal battles simply to secure basic compensation.

Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

Retail inflation rises to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in OctoberFood inflation remained in deflation for the sixth straight month, but the pace of decline narrowed sharply. The Consumer Food Price Index showed a contraction of 3.91% in November, compared to a much steeper 5.02% fall in October.

Silver prices cross Rs 2 lakh milestone: Is there more upside left?Silver has been on a strong upward streak over the past month, supported by a softer US dollar, falling global interest rates and renewed buying in industrial commodities.
Video: India Today Chairman Aroon Purie rings NSE bell to mark ITG's 50 yearsIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie rang the NSE bell on Friday to mark the Group's 50 years.
Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%

India–US trade deal talks move forward, but Delhi refuses to open agriculture marketIndia has refused to allow American agricultural products into the Indian market. India believes that permitting US farm goods would increase competitive pressure on domestic farmers and reduce their income.

Unclaimed wealth is rising in India. How silence around money is costing familiesA growing number of Indian families are learning that wealth without communication can turn into confusion, conflict and costly mistakes. The solution begins long before any will is written.

From TDS gaps to bank errors: Why your ITR refund is delayed and what to do nowSeveral taxpayers in India have not received their income tax refunds for the assessment year 2025-26, with delays attributed to verification errors and compliance checks.

Inside the world of India's ultra-rich: What they buy, how they liveHow are India's wealthiest families redefining luxury today, and what do their latest spending habits reveal about their lifestyles? Let's have a look.

entertainment.headline: Amy Schumer, Chris Fischer part ways after 7 years, focus on co-parenting Details emerge about the factors behind Amy Schumer and Chris Fischer's recent divorce, highlighting the impact of career ambitions and parenting on their relationship, according to sources close to the couple.

Randeep Hooda revisits Cellular Jail after Veer Savarkar, calls it deeply personal Randeep Hooda revisited Port Blair's Cellular Jail, where he had filmed his directorial debut Swatantrya Veer Savarkar, calling the experience deeply personal and historic. The actor reflected on Veer Savarkar's sacrifice while sharing moments from the unveiling of his statue at the iconic site.

Gal Gadot, Ashton Kutcher, others condemn deadly Hanukkah attack at Bondi Beach Hollywood stars including Gal Gadot, Ashton Kutcher and Many Moore, express shock and grief after a terror attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach during a Hanukkah celebration leaves 15 people dead and dozens injured.

The Price of Confession review: Crime thriller that promises more than it deliversRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025 The Price of Confession is a Korean psychological thriller streaming on Netflix. Despite strong performances, its story falters with less credible twists and missed emotional depth.

Dhurandhar box office Day 10: Ranveer-Akshaye Khanna's film crosses Rs 350 crore Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar continues its dream run at the box office, crossing Rs 350 crore in just 10 days and dominating its second week. The film has beaten Pushpa 2 in second Sunday collections and is now eyeing the lifetime record of KGF Chapter 2.

Legendary Hollywood director Rob Reiner, wife Michele found dead at LA home Rob Reiner is known for films such as A Few Good Men, When Harry Met Sally... and The Princess Bride. The couple was reportedly stabbed and the deaths are being probed as homicide.

Akhanda 2 box office Day 3: Balakrishna film mints Rs 60 crore in opening weekend Nandamuri Balarkrishna's Akhanda 2 minted Rs 60 crore nett in India during its opening weekend. The film zoomed past Rs 100 crore globally and is expected to continue its run.

SNL spoofs Actors on Actors series in holiday edition with Grinch and Scrooge The latest episode of SNL delivered a seasonal parody of Variety's 'Actors on Actors' series, featuring holiday favourites such as the Grinch, Scrooge, and Rudolph in a comedic roundtable.

Ben Affleck reunites with Jennifer Lopez and Jennifer Garner at kids' play Actors Ben Affleck, Jennifer Lopez, and Jennifer Garner were seen at a Los Angeles school play on Friday night, supporting their children while navigating ongoing personal histories. The event follows a period of high-profile relationship changes and public scrutiny.

Good to be home: Priyanka Chopra shares sweet family moments with Nick Jonas, Malti Priyanka Chopra shared sweet photos from her time at home with husband Nick Jonas and daughter Malti Marie, showing how much she enjoys simple family moments. The pictures gave fans a warm glimpse into her personal life.

Ajith Kumar kisses Shalini ahead of Malaysia race, video goes viral Actor Ajith Kumar was seen sharing a candid kiss with his wife, Shalini, as he prepared to leave for the Asian Le Mans Series in Malaysia. The gesture was captured on video, drawing widespread attention on social media and highlighting the couple's enduring bond.

Actor Dileep's movie screening in Kerala bus stopped after woman's bold protest A protest by a woman passenger led to the discontinuation of a Dileep film screening on a Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus, sparking debate among passengers. This incident comes days after Dileep was acquitted in the high-profile 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Why today's hit songs die fast: Single Papa music composer Aman Pant responds Music composer Aman Pant created unique Nagamese sounds for 'Family Man Season 3' and composed songs for Single Papa. He reflected on music's changing landscape, the AI influence and impact of corporatisation in the industry.

Kareena Kapoor, Ajay Devgn, Tiger Shroff meet football icon Lionel Messi in Mumbai Kareena Kapoor Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Tiger Shroff were among the Indian film celebrities who met football legend Lionel Messi in Mumbai. While Kareena and her sons, Taimur and Jeh, posed with Messi in Argentina jerseys at the CCI, Ajay and Tiger met him later at the Wankhede Stadium.

Manju Warrier slams 2017 sexual assault verdict, says justice is still incomplete Manju Warrier, referring to the Kerala actor assault case, said those who committed the crime were punished but the mind that planned the act walks free. Manju is the ex-wife of actor Dileep, an accused who was acquitted.

Kerala actor's first post after assault case verdict: Lost faith in this trial court Nearly a week after the Kerala actor assault case verdict, in which actor Dileep was acquitted and six others were convicted, the survivor has shared a post for the first time, criticising the trial court.

Jacob Elordi snaps at paparazzo: You make it really hard for me to live Actor Jacob Elordi was seen in a video having a heated exchange with a photographer at a Paris train station while trying to remain low-profile. The 28-year-old conveyed his frustration, telling the persistent individual they were making his life difficult as he travelled.

Kareena Kapoor shares glimpse as sons Taimur, Jeh get Messi-ready Lionel Messi has reached Mumbai for his GOAT India Tour 2025. Besides, young players from Maharashtra, celebrities like Kareena Kapoor and her sons are also joining the celebrations.

Sonakshi Sinha slams open attack on actors, critics; wants stricter laws Actor Sonakshi Sinha publicly expressed concern over an increase in online attacks targeting both actors and film critics, describing the trend as deeply disturbing and highlighting the urgent need for stricter laws.

general news.headline: Father, son behind Bondi Beach carnage that killed 15, duo reportedly from PakNew South Wales Police said the shooting, which targeted members of Sydney's Jewish community during the celebration, has been officially classified as a "terrorist attack".

Dense fog grips Delhi as AQI remains over severe, flight ops disruptedNear-zero visibility from dense fog combined with severe air pollution disrupted road traffic and delayed early morning flights in Delhi. An orange alert has also been issued by the weather department.

Who is Ahmed al Ahmed, fruitseller who tackled Sydney beach shooter at frontlineAhmed al Ahmed, a 43-year-old Sydney fruit shop owner, was shot twice after bravely tackling and disarming a gunman during a deadly attack at Bondi Beach. The targeted shooting at a Jewish Hanukkah event left at least 16 people dead and dozens injured.

'Are your lungs insured Messi?' Fans prepare to welcome GOAT in smoggy DelhiAs Lionel Messi nears to his arrival in fog-hit New Delhi, fans chose humour over chaos. Memes flooded social media, capturing the capital's weather, pollution and anticipation around the football icon's final India stop.

Video: Heroic bystander tackles, disarms Bondi Beach attackerThe clip captures the chaotic moments during the mass shooting at Bondi Beach, with the man confronting the gunman and disarming him as others flee the scene.

Live: My son didn't own a gun, he went for a swim, says mother of Bondi shooterSydney Bondi Beach Shooting Live Updates: Australia is reeling from its deadliest gun attack in nearly three decades after a targeted antisemitic shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach left many dead. Police have identified one of the gunmen as a 50-year-old man who was shot dead at the scene, while the suspected second shooter, his 24-year-old son, remains in critical condition in hospital. An ISIS flag was found in a car linked to the suspects, intensifying terrorism concerns. Authorities raided the family's home in Sydney's Bonnyrigg suburb as the investigation widened. Forty people, including two police officers, remain hospitalised, with victims ranging in age from 10 to 87. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates –

Thick fog in Delhi delays PM Modi's flight for Jordan, Ethiopia and Oman tourAs dense winter fog blanketed Delhi on Monday morning, authorities were forced to delay Prime Minister Narendra Modi's departure for his three-nation tour to Jordan, Ethiopia, and Oman. He later boarded his flight at around 9.30 am.

Stranded Indian begs for H-1B appointment slot: MAGA gloats, others vow helpIndians with jobs in the US are stranded in India as the Trump administration postponed H-1B interviews slated for December to March. A plea by one such person to fellow Indians on Reddit has gone viral. Though the MAGA crowd is claiming it as a sign of victory, others are vowing to help by creating visa interview slots.

A 10/10 evening: When Mumbai wrapped Lionel Messi and Sachin Tendulkar in loveMessi GOAT Tour in Mumbai: It was the fans who defined the night, as Mumbai poured its love on Lionel Messi and Sachin Tendulkar, creating a 10/10 moment driven by emotion, respect and shared admiration.

Supreme Court allows lawyers to appear virtually as AQI breaches severe markThe Supreme Court has permitted lawyers and litigants to appear via video conferencing amid Delhi's severe air pollution crisis, prioritising health and safety.

Why Yunus admin is dialing India for a pre-election shooting in BangladeshDays after the attack on anti-India and anti-Sheikh Hasina radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, the Yunus administration has sought India's help to arrest and hand over the shooters. This comes even as the Dhaka Metropolitan Police said there was no verified evidence the assailants crossed into India. Delhi, meanwhile, urged Dhaka to ensure law and order as there has been an uptick in violence with the election approaching.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

How Indians are raising the bar at house partiesProfessional bartenders and mixologists are elevating India's house party scene. Bring one in and give your party an instant, caramel-popcorn-level glow-up. Across metros, and even in smaller cities like Jabalpur and Nagpur, you can dial a bar home at just a day's notice. And prices start at just Rs 2,000.

Explained: Modi's diplomatic journey to fortify India's West Asia, Africa alliancesPrime Minister Narendra Modi's upcoming tour to Jordan, Ethiopia, and Oman aims to strengthen India's strategic and economic partnerships amid global challenges. The visit highlights India's commitment to energy security, trade growth, and diaspora engagement in these key regions.

India Today @ 50 Part 1: Revisiting India's most turbulent decadeIndia Today Group marks its 50th anniversary with a five-part docu-series reflecting on its impactful journey in Indian journalism. The series revisits pivotal moments from 1975 to 1985, highlighting political and cultural shifts that shaped the nation.

Nuclear device lost in Himalayas 60 years ago threatens Ganga todayIn 1965, at the height of Cold War anxieties over China's nascent nuclear programme, the CIA and India's Intelligence Bureau launched a covert mission to install a nuclear‑powered listening device high on Nanda Devi. Then the weather turned.

Huge responsibility for small worker: Nitin Nabin on appointment to key BJP postNitin Nabin's appointment as BJP national working president marks a significant generational shift, emphasising dedication and grassroots organisational work. His rise reflects the party's focus on nurturing young, dynamic leaders with strong ideological roots.

H-1B, H-4 visas prudentially revoked in US amid interview delays in IndiaAmid the mass rescheduling of H-1B visa interviews in India, many US-based temporary work visa holders have reportedly received emails informing them that their visas have been "prudentially revoked". An immigration expert says many previously cleared issues are being re-reviewed.

A 14-year-old at the door: Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi feels ready for India debutAt an age when most are still learning the game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi is forcing Indian cricket to confront an uncomfortable question: when talent arrives this early, can patience afford to wait?

Breast milk in necklaces, rings, earrings and more. What's with the hype?For parents, their kids grow up in fleeting moments. So, to preserve the warmth of the journey, especially for mothers, breast milk is being worn as pendants, earrings, rings, and more.

How a 1956 German offer built India's top IITIIT Madras was established in 1959 with the support of Germans. It was the third IIT to be set up in India. The plan behind setting up IITs was to match the quality of education of institutes like MIT.

Actor Dileep's movie screening in Kerala bus stopped after woman's bold protestA protest by a woman passenger led to the discontinuation of a Dileep film screening on a Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus, sparking debate among passengers. This incident comes days after Dileep was acquitted in the high-profile 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Pro-democracy Hong Kong media tycoon found guilty of national security offencesThe former Hong Kong media tycoon and a vocal critic of Beijing, Jimmy Lai, was convicted on Monday in a landmark national security case that could see him spend the rest of his life in prison. However, Lai had pleaded not guilty to all charges.

sports.headline: Messi in India Live: GOAT arrives in smog-hit New Delhi Messi in India, GOAT tour Day 3 live updates: The Argentine football icon is set to arrive in New Delhi as the capital battles severe fog and alarming air pollution levels. The conditions have shaped preparations around Messi's final stop in India.

New Zealand pacer Blair Tickner set to miss white-ball tour of India Blair Tickner is likely to miss New Zealand's five-match ODI and three-match T20I series in India, beginning on January 11, after dislocating his shoulder during the second Test against the West Indies.

Australia captain Pat Cummins calls for blood donations after Bondi Beach attack Australian cricket team captain Pat Cummins has issued an urgent appeal for blood donations following Sunday's deadly attack at Bondi Beach, which claimed 16 lives and left dozens injured.

Messi in New Delhi: Traffic police set new rules to avoid a Kolkata-like mess Delhi authorities have moved early to prevent crowd chaos as Lionel Messi's India tour reaches its final stop. After the Kolkata fallout, tighter traffic planning aims to ensure smoother movement and safer fan access.

Ashes: England coach issues clarification over viral 'overprepared' statement England head coach Brendon McCullum said his post-Brisbane "overprepared" comment was meant to protect the dressing room and that internal messages can sound different in public.

A 14-year-old at the door: Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi feels ready for India debut At an age when most are still learning the game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi is forcing Indian cricket to confront an uncomfortable question: when talent arrives this early, can patience afford to wait?

IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: 5 players SRH can target IPL Auction: SunRisers Hyderabad finished 6th in the last edition of the IPL. The team will be looking out for a specialist finisher and a couple of strong spin bowling options.

Shubman, Suryakumar will win matches for India at T20 World Cup: Abhishek India opener Abhishek Sharma has thrown his weight behind senior batters Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill ahead of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, expressing confidence that the duo will come good when it matters most.

Suryakumar Yadav and the unending search for form Suryakumar Yadav is now without a T20I fifty for 21 innings. When will his yearning for runs end? Can India afford out of form capyain and vice captain going into the T20 World Cup?

Xabi Alonso makes relationship with Vinicius Jr clear: Real Madrid is very unitedXabi Alonso shut down talk of unrest with a simple gesture. His hug with Vinícius Jr after substitution underlined Real Madrid's unity during their 2-1 La Liga win over Deportivo Alaves.

Bondi beach shooting: Michael Vaughan narrowly escapes attackFormer England cricketer Michael Vaughan narrowly survived the Bondi beach attack on Sunday. Two shooters opened fire in public, killing at least 11 and injuring close to 30.

Mumbai's message to Kolkata: Messi-merising evening with real GOAT crowdThe city of Mumbai turned up in numbers to get a glimpse of Lionel Messi at the Wankhede Stadium. The event went smoothly, and produced several memorable moments, prompting the Maharashtra CM to tweet that Mumbai has the GOAT fans.

Arshdeep makes the ball talk in Dharamsala, dedicates POTM award to 10-year-old nieceArshdeep Singh bounced back strongly in Dharamsala, using swing and seam to outthink South Africa before dedicating his Player of the Match award to his 10-month-old niece.

Arshdeep, Varun combine as India blow away South Africa in DharamsalaIND vs SA: India completed yet another thumping win against South Africa in the 5-match T20I series. The bowling unit, led by Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakravarthy blew away the Proteas in Dharamsala.

India wins maiden squash world cup with 3-0 victory over Hong KongIndia won its first-ever Squash World Cup title with a dominant 3-0 win over Hong Kong in Chennai. The historic victory marks a new high for Indian squash and could become a watershed moment for the sport in the country.

Varun Chakaravarthy spins magic in Dharamsala, 2nd fastest Indian to 50 T20I wicketsIND vs SA, 3rd T20I: Varun Chakaravarthy delivered a clinical performance in Dharamsala, rattling South Africa's middle order and becoming the second-fastest Indian to reach 50 T20I wickets.

IND vs SA: All-round Hardik Pandya scripts history with 100 T20I wicketsIND vs SA: Hardik Pandya reached the landmark of 100 T20I wickets in the Dharamsala T20I, thereby becoming the fifth cricketer in Men's T20Is to achieve the feat. He also became the third Indian in Men's T20Is with 100 wickets.

Messi, Sachin, Chhetri: GOATs meet at Wankhede to create epic moments in MumbaiLionel Messi's GOAT tour moment saw some epic moments in Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium. The legendary Argentine meet the very best of Indian sports - Sachin Tendulkar and Sunil Chhetri and exchanged jerseys.

Bumrah misses Dharamsala T20I due to personal reasons, returns to MumbaiIndia vs South Africa, 3rd T20I: Jasprit Bumrah was unavailable for selection on Sunday due to personal reasons. The fast bowler flew to Mumbai and could miss the last two matches of the series.

Unstoppable India crush Pakistan to continue flawless run in U19 Asia CupIndia U19 extended their unbeaten run in the U19 Asia Cup with a commanding 90-run win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, posting 240 and restricting their rivals to 150.

Messi's Kolkata Visit Turns Chaotic: Fans Allege Mismanagement, Vandalise Salt Lake StadiumIn this Special Report, an Unidentified speaker reports from Kolkata's Yuva Bharati Krirangan on the chaotic scenes during Lionel Messi's visit. The reporter highlights 'total mismanagement' as fans, angry over Messi's brief 'eight to nine minutes' appearance, vandalised the stadium. The transcript details how spectators threw bottles and set fire to seats meant for VVIPs, including Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Despite the presence of superstars Rodrigo De Paul and Luis Suarez, the event descended into a 'ruckus' with allegations of poor visibility and cancelled interactions.

Messi gets Aadhaar card from fans, Wankhede Stadium echoes with chants: See photoLionel Messi's trip to India: From Marine Drive to Wankhede, fans celebrated Messi with chants, packed local trains and even a mock Aadhaar card, underlining the extraordinary devotion surrounding his Mumbai visit on Sunday, December 14.

Messi event fiasco will hurt Kolkata for decades: Indian football chief Kalyan ChaubeyAIFF president Kalyan Chaubey slammed the West Bengal government over chaos at Lionel Messi's Kolkata event, warning poor planning could hurt the city and India's global sporting image for decades.

Two days before IPL auction, Sarfaraz Khan smashes 25-ball 64 for MumbaiSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy: Sarfaraz Khan smashed 64 in just 25 balls, leading Mumbai's successful chase of 235 against Haryana. Sarfaraz is likely to trigger a bidding war in the IPL 2026 mini auction, scheduled in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday, December 16.

Ashes: England security guard gets involved in heated face-off with media personA confrontation unfolded at Brisbane airport when an England cricket team security official had a heated exchange with a Channel Seven cameraman during the squad's check-in for their Adelaide flight.

Insult or banter? BBL trolls Babar Azam after Pakistan batter fails on debutPakistan batter Babar Azam made a disappointing BBL debut for Sydney Sixers on December 14, scoring just two runs off five balls before being dismissed by Brody Couch, sparking online trolling.

Next Sanju Samson? Aaron George, Kerala-born Hyderabad batter, impresses vs PakistanU19 Asia Cup India vs Pakistan: Aaron George played a composed knock of 85 off 88 balls to rescue India after early setbacks in clash against Pakistan in Dubai, building crucial partnerships and drawing comparisons to Sanju Samson with his stylish strokeplay.

U19 Asia Cup: Did India, Pakistan defy ICC directive by snubbing handshake?India Under-19s maintained their no-handshake stance against Pakistan in the Asia Cup despite an ICC push for protocol, keeping the spotlight on the ongoing handshake debate as the rivals are likely to meet again later in the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
